1.text: Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

2.text: For knowing wisdom and instruction, For understanding sayings of intelligence,

3.text: For receiving the instruction of wisdom, Righteousness, judgment, and uprightness,

4.text: For giving to simple ones—prudence, To a youth—knowledge and discretion.

5.text: (The wise doth hear and increaseth learning, And the intelligent doth obtain counsels.)

6.text: For understanding a proverb and its sweetness, Words of the wise and their acute sayings.

7.text: Fear of Jehovah is a beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and instruction fools have despised!

8.text: Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother,

9.text: For a graceful wreath are they to thy head, And chains to thy neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice thee be not willing.

11.text: If they say, ‘Come with us, we lay wait for blood, We watch secretly for the innocent without cause,

12.text: We swallow them as Sheol—alive, And whole—as those going down to the pit,

13.text: Every precious substance we find, We fill our houses with spoil,

14.text: Thy lot thou dost cast among us, One purse is—to all of us.’

15.text: My son! go not in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path,

16.text: For their feet to evil do run, And they haste to shed blood.

17.text: Surely in vain is the net spread out before the eyes of any bird.

18.text: And they for their own blood lay wait, They watch secretly for their own lives.

19.text: So are the paths of every gainer of dishonest gain, The life of its owners it taketh.

20.text: Wisdom in an out-place crieth aloud, In broad places she giveth forth her voice,

21.text: At the head of the multitudes she calleth, In the openings of the gates, In the city her sayings she saith:

22.text: ‘Till when, ye simple, do ye love simplicity? And have scorners their scorning desired? And do fools hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn back at my reproof, lo, I pour forth to you my spirit, I make known my words with you.

24.text: Because I have called, and ye refuse, I stretched out my hand, and none is attending,

25.text: And ye slight all my counsel, And my reproof ye have not desired.

26.text: I also in your calamity do laugh, I deride when your fear cometh,

27.text: When your fear cometh as destruction, And your calamity as a hurricane doth come, When on you come adversity and distress.

28.text: Then they call me, and I do not answer, They seek me earnestly, and find me not.

29.text: Because that they have hated knowledge, And the fear of Jehovah have not chosen.

30.text: They have not consented to my counsel, They have despised all my reproof,

31.text: And they eat of the fruit of their way, And from their own counsels they are filled.

32.text: For the turning of the simple slayeth them, And the security of the foolish destroyeth them.

33.text: And whoso is hearkening to me dwelleth confidently, And is quiet from fear of evil!’
